titleStmt.title: HN01 To Mr 08. Tho: Sheridan
HN02 Revd 08: and Learned Sr 08.

HN03 I am Teacher of English for a want of a better to a poor Charity School in the Lower end of St 08. Thomas Street, but in my time I have been a Virgilian, tho' I am now forc'd to Teach English, wch 08. I understand less than my own Native Language, or even than Latin it Self; therefore I make bold to send Yu the inclosed, the Fruit of My Muse, in hopes it may qualifye me for the honour of being one of Your most inferiour Ushers: if You will Vouchsafe to send me an Answer, direct it to me next door but one to the Harrow on the Left hand in Crocker's-Lane. I am Yrs 08.
HN04 Revd 08: Sr 08. to Command
HN05 Pat: Reyly.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

encodingDesc.p: ed. JW 3SE09; Reyly letter added JW 26MR17

lg.l: Scribimus Indocti, doctiq; Poemata passim. Horat:
Deliciæ Sheridam, Musarum dulcis Amice,
Sic tibi propitius Permessi ad Flumen Apollo
Occurrat, seu te Mimum convivia rident
Æquivocosve sales spargis, seu Ludere Versu
Malles; Dic Sheridan, quisnam fuit ille Deorum
Quæ melior Natura Orto Tibi Tradidit Artem
Rimandi Genium puerorum atq; Ima Cerebri
Scrutandi? Tibi Nascenti ad Cunabula Pallas
Astitit, et Dixit, mentis præsaga futuræ.
Heu Puer Infælix: Nostro sub sidere Natus
Nam tu Pectus eris sine Corpore, Corporis Umbra,
Sed Levitate Umbram superabis, Voce Cicadam,
Non Crassæ tibi erunt Tibiæ non Venter Obesus;
Musca Femur, Palmas tibi Mus dabit, Ardea Crura
Corpore sed tenui; tibi quod Natura negabit,
Hoc Animi Dotes Explebunt: Teq; docente
Nec longum Tempus, surget tibi docta Iuventus
Artibus egregiis Animas instructa Novellas.
Hinc strenuus prodit Dux, hinc Neptunia proles,
Pæonis hinc proles Venit ecce Salutifer Orbi
Ast illi causas orant, his infula Visa est.
Divinam Capiti nodo constringere Mitram.
Natalis te horæ non fallunt signa, sed usq;
Conscius Expedias, puero seu Lætus Apollo
Nascenti Arrisit, sive illum frigidus horror
Saturni premit, aut septem inflavere Triones.
Quin tu altè penitusq; latentia semina cernis,
Quæq; diu obtundendo olim sub luminis Aur\add·e\as
Eruptura promis; quo risu sæpe puella
Sub cinere immundo sopitos suscitat ignes,
Te Dominum Agnoscit quo·cunq; sub aere natus
Quos indulgentis nimium Custodia Matris
Pessundat, nam sæpe Vides in stipite Matrem
Aureus iste Arbor, Venerandæ Dona Sibyllæ
Æneæ sedes tantum patefecit Avernos;
Sæpe Puer Tua quem tetigit semel Aurea Virga
Cœlumq; terrasq; Videt Noctemq; profundum.
«LD»sic cecini.
